00011 #include "Dbj.hpp"
00012 #include "DbjSystem.hpp"

00014 #include <stdlib.h> // EXIT_SUCCESS, EXIT_FAILURE
00015 
00016 static const DbjComponent componentId = Support;
00017 
00018 
00031 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00032 {
00033     int retCode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
00034     DbjErrorCode rc = DBJ_SUCCESS;
00035     DbjError error;
00036 
00037     DBJ_TRACE_ENTRY();
00038 
00039     if ((argc != 1 && argc != 2) ||
00040             (argc == 2 && DbjStringCompare(argv[1], "force") != DBJ_EQUALS)) {
00041         printf("\nUsage: %s [force]\n\n", argv[0]);
00042         return EXIT_FAILURE;
00043     }
00044 
00045     rc = DbjSystem::stop(argc == 2 ? true : false);
00046     if (rc != DBJ_SUCCESS) {
00047         DBJ_TRACE_ERROR();
00048         goto cleanup;
00049     }
00050 
00051  cleanup:
00052     if (DbjGetErrorCode() == DBJ_SUCCESS) {
00053         printf("The system was stopped successfully. SQLSTATE=00000\n");
00054         retCode = EXIT_SUCCESS;
00055     }
00056     else {
00057         char errorMessage[1000] = { '\0' };
00058         char sqlstate[6] = { '\0' };
00059         error.getError(errorMessage, sizeof errorMessage, sqlstate);
00060         printf("%s SQLSTATE=%s\n", errorMessage, sqlstate);
00061         retCode = EXIT_FAILURE;
00062     }
00063     printf("\n");
00064     DbjSystem::stopAllManagers();
00065     {
00066         DbjMemoryManager *memMgr = DbjMemoryManager::getMemoryManager();
00067         if (memMgr != NULL) {
00068             memMgr->dumpMemoryTrackInfo();
00069         }
00070     }
00071     return retCode;
00072 }
